Key Arguments: Free speech is an all-or-nothing concept and should not be limited by government.
Public debate is the most effective way to combat misinformation and disinformation.
Government control over online discussions could lead to authoritarianism.
Individuals should be able to critically assess information from multiple sources.
The legislation could be used to silence dissenting opinions.
International complications may arise due to the global nature of digital platforms.
Existing laws already address issues like incitement to violence.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is an all-or-nothing concept; there are no gradations where it can be slightly limited.
If the government starts dictating what can or cannot be discussed online, both publicly and privately, our democratic society will transform into an authoritarian regime.
It is unnecessary to introduce more top-down authoritarian legislation telling us what we can and cannot say, hear, see or listen to.
